oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Chickamauga Battle Survivor, Larkin H. Poe, at the site of his Old Home

oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Battlefields; Historical markers
United States - History - Civil War, 1861-1865; Chickamauga and Chattanooga National Military Park (Ga. and Tenn.)
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Larkin H. Poe, age 94, standing on the site of his old home on the Chickamauga Batlefield. The house was burned to the ground during the battle.

The Battle of Chickamauga was fought in September 1863 between the armies of Braxton Bragg and William Rosecrans. After days of hard fighting the Confederate Army drove Rosecrans from the field but failed to achieve lasting success.; The battle was fought in parts of Tennessee and Georgia and on the farming properties of many citizens. Part of the battle was fought on "Poe Field," on the property of Larkin H. Poe. The Georgia monument stands across the road from this site.
